cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles ESE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest today, then turning north-northwest and north Monday, skirting just offshore the Georgia coast toward the southern Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coastal South Carolina or extreme southeastern North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of South Santee River SC to Surf City NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hallandale Beach FL to South Santee River SC (includes the entire Georgia coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East-central Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph, gusts 50 mph) possible Monday as the center passes offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 1–3 ft above ground possible along the Georgia coast around times of high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain forecast for coastal Georgia, producing brief urban or low-lying flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; minor coastal flooding at high tide
